title: Energy Majors Warn EU Climate Push Could Gut Supply Security
summary: The European Union is putting its energy security at risk by attempting to regulate every single molecule of energy products it will import in 2027, the year in which the EU will ban Russian natural gas. title: Big Oil’s Billion-Dollar Bet on the Caspian Is Paying Off
summary: To identify the regions generating the most cash for majors, we forecast the group’s top five projects by cumulative free cash flow for the period 2025 to 2030. title: Argentina’s Vaca Muerta Shale Is Smashing Oil Production Records in 2025
summary: In a surprise development, Argentina’s unconventional oil production hit a new all-time high for September 2025. title: Oil Prices Plunge 2.5% as OPEC, IEA Outlooks Point to Softer Market
summary: Oil prices tumbled on Tuesday, with Brent down 2.46% at $63.56 a barrel at 9:54 a.m. ET, and West Texas Intermediate (WTI) slid 2.64% to $59.43, as traders reacted to fresh signals of easing supply pressure and waning demand momentum through early 2026. title: Trump’s Tariffs Send U.S. Aluminum Prices to Record Highs
summary: Aluminum prices in the U.S. climbed to new record highs on Monday as domestic inventories tightened sharply, driven by the Trump administration’s steel and aluminum tariffs designed to bolster and revitalize America’s industrial base. title: Oil and gas demand to rise for 25 years without global change of course, says IEA
